qas.question: In which year was the Quran first translated into a Western language?
Who completed the first Latin version of the Quran?
Whose French translation of the Quran was the model for the first English version?
Which organization offers versions of the Quran in 50 languages?
In which language was Alexander Ross' version of the Quran published in 1649?
In which year was the Quran last translated into a Western language?
Who completed the last Latin version of the Quran?
Whose French translation of the Quran was the model for the last English version?
Which organization offers versions of the Quran in 60 languages?
In which language was Alexander Ross' version of the Quran published in 1694?

context: <a1_0><b6_0>Robert of Ketton<b6_0/><a1_0/>'s <a0_0><b5_0>1143<b5_0/><a0_0/> translation of the Quran for Peter the Venerable, Lex Mahumet pseudoprophete, was the first into a Western language (Latin). Alexander Ross offered the first <a4_0><b9_0>English<b9_0/><a4_0/> version in 1649, from the French translation of L'Alcoran de Mahomet (1647) by <a2_0><b7_0>Andre du Ryer<b7_0/><a2_0/>. In 1734, George Sale produced the first scholarly translation of the Quran into English; another was produced by Richard Bell in 1937, and yet another by Arthur John Arberry in 1955. All these translators were non-Muslims. There have been numerous translations by Muslims. The <a3_0><b8_0>Ahmadiyya Muslim Community<b8_0/><a3_0/> has published translations of the Quran in 50 different languages besides a five-volume English commentary and an English translation of the Quran.
